009
010package imagingbook.pub.corners;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
013
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015
016
017/**
018 * This is an implementation of the Shi-Tomasi corner detector, as 
019 * described in
020 * <blockquote>
021 *  J. Shi and C. Tomasi. Good features to track. In “Proceedings
022 *  of IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition,
023 *  CVPR’94”, pp. 593–600, Seattle, WA, USA (1994).
024 * </blockquote>
025 * 
026 * @author W. Burger
027 * @version 2020/10/05
028 */
029public class MopsCornerDetector extends GradientCornerDetector {
030        
031        public static class Parameters extends GradientCornerDetector.Parameters {
032                
033                public Parameters() {
034                        scoreThreshold = 100;   // individual default threshold
035                }
036        }
037
038        public MopsCornerDetector(ImageProcessor ip, Parameters params) {
039                super(ip, params);
040        }
041        
042        // --------------------------------------------------------------
043
044        @Override
045        protected float computeCornerScore(float A, float B, float C) {
046                float trace = A + B;
047                if (isZero(trace)) {
048                        return UndefinedScoreValue;
049                }
050                float det = A * B - C * C;
051                return det / trace;
052        }
053
054}
